Examination of official records: The expert may have reviewed official records and documents related to the welfare system in Wisconsin during the governor's term to determine if there were significant changes or an end to welfare programs.
Analysis of policy changes: The expert may have analyzed the policy changes implemented by the Wisconsin governor during his tenure to identify any specific actions or legislation that aimed to end or significantly reform welfare programs.
Comparison with statistical data: The expert might have compared statistical data on welfare recipients and program expenditures in Wisconsin before and after the governor's term to assess if there was a significant decrease or termination of welfare assistance.
Interviews and statements: The expert could have conducted interviews or examined public statements made by the governor or other relevant officials to gather insights into their intentions and actions regarding welfare programs.
